reporting-org.narrative: Wageningen University & Research - Stichting Wageningen Research

title.narrative: Integrated Seed Sector Development Myanmar - Developing a Vibrant Public-Private Seed System for Rice, Oilseeds and Legumes in the Dry Zone

description.narrative: By 2020, ISSD Myanmar will have reached the following target groups: smallholder men and women farmers, seed producers, local seed businesses, seed companies, input dealers, members of seed associations, policy makers, staff of the department of agriuculture, researchers from the department of agricultural research, staff of the department of cooperatives, agricultural researchers and development partners investing in seed sector development in Myanmar.

The Integrated Seed Sector Development Myanmar supports developing a vibrant public-private seed system for rice, oilseeds and legumes in the dry zone in Myanmar to cater for the quality seed need of smallholder farmers in this zone.

The goal of the project is contribute to food and nutritional security and climate resilience of thousands of smallholder farmers in the Dry Zone of Myanmar, by improving smallholder farmer access and uptake of quality seed of improved and well adapted varieties of rice, legumes and oil seed crops in the Dry Zone. The theory of change (ToC) is based on three pathways that jointly contribute to this overall goal: (1) Improved seed sector coordination: ISSD Myanmar will establish seed sector platforms together with key seed sector stakeholders, establish seed growers’ associations, and support seed demand forecasting (2) Increased business performance of Early Generation Seed (EGS) producing seed farms: ISSD Myanmar will promote public-private business models in ten seed farms involved in EGS production and strengthen the capacity of seed farm staff on EGS production (3) Increased local availability and uptake of quality seed at affordable price to smallholder farmers: ISSD Myanmar will support the establishment of local seed businesses, strengthen seed companies in their business operations and facilitate the variety demonstrations.

[DONOR RESULT FNS] Performance of family farming systems increased
Number of family farms with increased productivity and/or income (DONOR INDICATOR)

comment.narrative: Male/Female headed that are between 18 years and 35.
Tacking of this indicators is from project beginning, no data exist on this
Tacking of this indicators is from project beginning, no data exist on this

title.narrative: EGS study implemented providing clear guidelines for different types of business models (public, private, mixed) for EGS production
Number of crop types covered by the EGS study

comment.narrative: EGS study covered cereals, pulses and oil seed crops.

title.narrative: Alternative business models for EGS production piloted with seed farms
Number of EGS business pilots implemented in DAR and DOA farms

comment.narrative: In 2018 the EGS study been conducted and concepts on 4 differrent business models have been developed: EGS production by seed companies, variety use agreements, digital EGS demand forecasting systems, sed farm development fund. Piloting will start in 2019.

title.narrative: National seed association established and functional
National seed association established

comment.narrative: In 2018 the constitution of the association was revised, and discussed with the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock and Irrigation and the the Myanmar Investment Commission, in 2019 the association was established

title.narrative: Number of seed association members
Number of seed association meetings
Regional seed growers’ associations established in Nay Pyi Taw, Mandalay, Sagaing and Bago regions
Number of regional seed growers associations established

comment.narrative: In 2018 the potential modalities of regional seed growers associations was studied, associations have not yet formed.

title.narrative: Zonal seed sector platform established and functional
Total number of actors participating in Seed Platform meetings

comment.narrative: In the platforms we had in 2017, and 2018 we reached 75 people with each platform. 60% of the people participating are regular participants, 40% of the participants are new representatives of the actors involved or representatives of new actors.

title.narrative: Types of actorse participating in Seed Platform meetings

comment.narrative: We reached the following ' types' : government agriculture departments (DOA, DAR), domestic seed comapnies, international seed companies, agro-input dealers, seed growers associations, development partners, millers and grain traders, members of parliament, media , government department of cooperatives

title.narrative: Number of joint pilots on seed value chain issues endorsed

comment.narrative: We started a pilots on: variety use agreements, EGS demand forecasting, income generating businiss models for seed farms.

title.narrative: Increased business performance of EGS producing seed farms
[DONOR FNS INDICATOR] No. of persons (male/female/youth) reached/trained with improved technology and skills in EGS production

comment.narrative: A total of 83 EGS seed farm staff has been trained (34F, 49M).

title.narrative: Number of seed farms working with new business model for EGS production
Capacity of seed farm staff on EGS production strengthened
Number of DAR and DOA staff trained

comment.narrative: A total of 83 EGS seed farm staff has been trained.

title.narrative: Number of trainings/workshops
Improved seed sector coordination
Number of collaborations established or strengthened
Studies on key seed sector bottlenecks supported and presented in the platform meetings
Number of studies implemented in the Dry Zone
Study on seed demand assessment published for the Dry Zone
Number of studies implemented in the Dry Zone
Increased local availability and uptake of quality seed at affordable price to smallholder farmers
[DONOR FNS INDICATOR] Number of persons (male/female/youth) reached/trained with improved technology and skills in seed production

comment.narrative: A total of 132 seed producers have participated in different trainings on improved technologies and skills in seed production.

title.narrative: Total number of farmers reached (m/female/youth, indirect)

comment.narrative: We have a target of total of 75.550 for the full project period, we reached 80,644 farmers (38,586F, 42,059M).

title.narrative: Number of new improved and well-adapted varieties used by farmers in selected townships

comment.narrative: Out of the 26 varieties that are currently under seed production, 11 varieties are new with a variety release data less that 10 years ago.

title.narrative: Total number of hectares of farmland reached (indirect)

comment.narrative: We have calculated the total ha sown with quality seed by dividing the seed sales per crop by the seeding rate per hectare for that crop. In 2020 report we adjusted the target from 15.000 to 63067)

title.narrative: Volume of quality seed produced (MT)
Local seed businesses development scaled through strategic partnerships
Number of partners supporting LSBs

comment.narrative: Department of Cooperatives has been selected as partner 2019.

title.narrative: Number of local seed businesses supported by partners

comment.narrative: Department of Cooperatives started supporting local seed businesses in 2019

title.narrative: Commercially viable local seed businesses (LSBs) established
Number of functional local seed businesses directly supported by the programme

comment.narrative: ISSD myanmar supported 72 seed producers

Seed companies strengthened in their business operations

comment.narrative: ISSD supported: Green Growth Generation, Greensish Sagain, Shwe Nan Taw.
